intro: Piptocarpha cinerea, commonly known as silverleaf flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, fuzzy hairs. The plant produces small, clustered blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Piptocarpha cinerea is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads.
